Description: The FHIR DocumentReference resource describes information about a document. The read interaction enables the look up of a DocumentResource resource by a constant server ID. The read interaction allows clients to store only the server ID, and with a single request, retrieve the most up-to-date DocumentReference information on a document. Read interactions typically begin with a client having previously established a relationship, often through querying for DocumentReferences through the search interaction.
SampleResponse:
<DocumentReference xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir">

<id value="e1AE1NCGysUfvBQvG2rIJ90Xbo3xORooK5lceHLykX2M3"/>

<status value="current"/>

<docStatus value="preliminary"/>

<type>

<coding>

<system value="http://loinc.org"/>

<code value="11506-3"/>

<display value="Progress Note"/>

</coding>

<coding>

<system value="urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.861.1.7.4.737880.5010"/>

<code value="1"/>

<display value="Progress Notes"/>

</coding>

<text value="Progress Notes"/>

</type>

<subject>

<reference value="https://hostname/instance/api/FHIR/STU3/Patient/efvHwbc1k1CQ9XjM1zvvefQ3"/>

<display value="Fhir D Cds Jr., Esq."/>

</subject>

<created value="2018-03-01T21:04:35Z"/>

<indexed value="2018-03-01T21:04:35Z"/>

<author>

<reference value="https://hostname/instance/api/FHIR/STU3/Practitioner/eA6CcVv.bIBLSIkZM-b.9Bg3"/>

<display value="Srovider, Starter"/>

</author>

<content>

<attachment>

<url value="https://hostname/instance/api/FHIR/STU3/Binary/eoHLRJp.lMo5.q5J5BCimj1FJ3b7tchqWgFtRWzeznkU3"

/>

</attachment>

</content>

<context>

<encounter>

<reference value="https://hostname/instance/api/FHIR/STU3/Encounter/eO2pW5pfb3.99TYMaBfbkykrJLqtdDEeCOPb0JMpQwJs3"

/>

</encounter>

</context>

</DocumentReference>

DocumentReference.Name: DocumentReference
DocumentReference.Description: An instance of the STU3 DocumentReference resource.

authenticator.Name: authenticator
authenticator.Description: Who or what authenticated the document.

author.Name: author
author.Description: Who or what authored the document.

class.Name: class
class.Description:
The category for the resource. Only the following values are supported:

  • clinical-note
  • clinical-notes
    • This value does not follow the specification and is supported only for backward compatibility.

contentType.Name: contentType
contentType.Description: Media type of the resource. This is always "text/html" for clinical notes.

url.Name: url
url.Description: The URI where the data can be found. A reference to the Binary resource which contains the document content.

context.Name: context
context.Description: The context of the document content.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: Reference to an Encounter resource as the context of the document content.

period.Name: period
period.Description: This is the time of the service that is being documented.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: The note identifier from the Epic system.

indexed.Name: indexed
indexed.Description: When this document reference was created, which is the same as Created time for notes.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The Patient FHIR ID for whom the clinical note was written.

type.Name: type
type.Description:
The note type.

Can be in the format:

  • code= Note Type value from category list INP 5010
  • system=customer-specific oid for category list INP 5010

For example:"urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.0.1.7.4.737880.5010"

Otherwise, can be mapped using a core set of the Epic-released category values to LOINC codes:

  • code="10164-2"
  • system="https://loinc.org/"
